alxartes wrote:
> Hope someone would answer the following inquiries.
>
> 1. How can we run 2 simultaneous crawls? We wanted to run 2 or multiple
> crawls at the same time because we are time constraint and have a lot
> of web sites to crawl. We also wanted that each website has its own arc
> file. I tried running a second heritrix at a different port but it
> would not start up. How can I do it?

I'm guessing you're asking about running two instances on the same 
hardware and that you got an exception complaining about address already 
in use?

Heritrix on a 1.5 JVM sets up listeners on two ports.  There is one 
listening port for the web UI and then another listening port for the 
JMX Agent.

You can stipulate the web UI port from the command line but specifying 
the JMX port on the command line is a little awkward because we're using 
the JVM's JMX Agent.  The JVM's JMX Agent takes its configuration as 
java system properties passed on the command-line.  By the time the 
Heritrix command-line processing goes into effect, the JVM's JMX Agent 
configuration has been acted on (Later we'll put up our own JMX Agent. 
Then it'll be possible to dictate as a command-line option to Heritrix 
the port to listen on).

Meantime, you need to use the JMX_PORT environment variable.  Here is 
how you would run two Heritrix instances on same hardware, one on 
default ports of 8080 for UI and 8849 for JMX Agent and the other with a 
UI on port 8081 and its JMX Agent on 8850:

% ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/heritrix
% JMX_PORT=8850 ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/heritrix --port=8081

If you're problem is other than the above, please paste in the exception 
you got on crawl fail (Check content of ${HERITRIX_HOME}/heritrix_out.log).

>
> 2. I also noticed that in the console, only one thread is active most
> of the time. Is this normal? I am worried because I have allerts like
> https://guides-online.visitsingapore.com/tgls/loginProcess1.jsp RIS
> still open. Should have been closed by method release: ToeThread #35:
> https://guides-online.visitsingapore.com/tgls/loginProcess1.jsp(in 
> <https://guides-online.visitsingapore.com/tgls/loginProcess1.jsp%28in>
> processor HTTP).
>
If you are using a single crawl to crawl a single site, yes, because the 
crawler is trying to be 'polite'.  See '6.3.3.1. Politeness' in the User 
Manual, http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html.  See also 
'7.1.2. Job Status Box' under the 'Load' section for discussion of why 
only a few threads are running and 'Politeness' in the glossary.

Regards the 'RIS still open', which version of Heritrix are you using?
